result.title: ET Pro: January 4th 2022
result.html:
Hey ,

Welcome to this week’s Exploding Topics Pro Investor report.

In this report…

Meta trends: Gaming Altcoins and Luxury DTC Food.

Early bird companies: Momcozy (breastfeeding aid startup), Biswap (three-type referral DEX), Thisworx (DTC car tools), Terraswap (Terra-based AMM DEX), MyFO (family office management SaaS).

Tomorrow’s products today: Interdental brush, AR NFT, smart cutting board, SPC flooring, libido gummies.

Do you have any feedback? We’d love to hear what you think. Just respond to let us know.
Meta Trend #1
Gaming Altcoins
More advanced blockchain gaming platforms, combined with growing interest in decentralized metaverses, is primarily driving the fast-growing demand for gaming altcoins.

The SOUL coin is the cryptocurrency of the Phantasma blockchain.

Searches for “SOULS coin” have increased by 83% in the last five years.

Phantasma is built specifically for gaming, meaning that it offers pre-built features to developers building blockchain games.

This altcoin is currently priced at $2.21 and has a market cap of around $228M.

The UOS coin is the Ultra platform token.

Searches for “UOS Coin” have increased by 8500% in the last two years.

Ultra is an all-in-one platform where users can play and stream games, chat with streamers and compete in tournaments.

UOS is currently priced at $1.55 and has a market cap of approximately $418M.

Chromia is a three-tiered blockchain: Chromia for games, Chromia for enterprises and Chromia for DeFi.

Searches for “Chromia coin” have increased by 8700% in the last 24 months.

Many popular games, such as My Neighbor Alice, have been built on this blockchain.

The WAXP coin is the cryptocurrency of the WAX blockchain.

Searches for “WAXP Coin” have increased by 8700% in the last two years.

WAX blockchain is known for being tailored to NFTs and video games.

The WAXP coin is currently priced at $0.48 and has a market cap of around $900M.

The ALICE coin is the native currency of the My Neighbor Alice blockchain game.

Searches for “ALICE Coin” have increased by 1085% in the last 24 months.
Meta Trend #2
Luxury DTC Food
DTC is emerging as the go-to distribution method for new luxury food brands.

This channel allows for better margins and more control over the brand experience, which are especially important for high-end food and beverage brands.

Mid-day Squares sells high-protein, high-fiber chocolate bars.

Searches for “Mid-day Squares” have increased 99X+ in the last 24 months.

The startup sells three flavors of their chocolate.

In addition to DTC, the company’s products are also sold in brick-and-mortar stores in Canada.

EatBetter is a low-carb, plant-based food DTC startup.

Searches for “EatBetter” have increased by 7100% in the last 24 months.

The startup’s current product is a high-protein bagel called the Better Bagel.

Searches for “Better Bagel” have increased by 300% in the past 24 months.

Catalina Crunch is a startup that makes and sells keto-friendly snacks.

The startup sells eight core SKUs.

Catalina Crunch has raised $4.8M in funding.

Barnana sells banana-based plantain chips and grain-free banana bites

Searches for “Barnana” have increased by 177% in the last six months.

Their pack of plantain chips brings in an estimated $60K/month on Amazon.

Snow Days is a DTC food startup selling grain-free pizza rolls.

The startup currently sells three core SKUs.
Early Bird Companies
Momcozy (website, search trend)

Momcozy manufactures and sells breastfeeding aids, such as breast pumps and pumping bras.

While Momcozy launched back in 2017, interest in the startup has exploded mainly due to videos on TikTok. In fact, the #momcozy hashtag has over 59 million views on TikTok.

The startup currently sells 15 core SKUs.

Their hands-free pumping bra brings in an estimated $30K/month on Amazon (AMZscout).

Momcozy has sold over 400,000 units of its products to date.

What’s next:
Momcozy is part of the Breastfeeding Tech meta trend.

Breastfeeding is currently experiencing the “Silicon Valley treatment” with several new, advanced breastfeeding product categories.

High-tech breastfeeding products are especially popular among affluent, working moms, who have less time and energy to go through the traditional breastfeeding process.

Examples of trending products in this space include wearable breast pumps, nursing pads and milk collection cups.

Biswap (website, search trend)

Biswap is a decentralized exchange built on the Binance Smart Chain.

The platform is mainly known for its three-type referral system.

What is the three-type referral system?

User A can invite user B to join Biswap. After user B joins, user A gets a commission every time user B makes a swap on Biswap. Additionally, user A receives a 5% commission of the income user B generates through farms and launchpools.

The total value locked in the Biswap protocol has increased approximately 18000x from May 2021 (current TVL in Biswap is roughly $570M).

Earlier this year, Binance announced a strategic investment in Biswap, which is partly why this protocol is trending.

What’s next:
Biswap is part of the Crypto Referral Programs meta trend.

There are now more than 7,500 cryptocurrencies worldwide (a 3x increase from 2019).

Which means that a protocol’s underlying tech is no longer enough for a project to get traction. Instead, new protocols now require creative user acquisition strategies to compete.

And a growing number of web3 projects are tapping into the referral program model. In fact, several new protocols, such as BlockFi and Cake DeFi gained traction largely thanks to their popular referral programs.

Even established players such as Coinbase and FTX have started introducing referral programs in an effort to attract more users.

Thisworx (website, search trend)

Thisworx is a DTC car tool and accessory startup.

The startup is mainly known for its car vacuum cleaner.

Thisworx’s rapid growth is largely due to their influencer-focused digital marketing approach.

In fact, the #thisworx hashtag has over 1.4 million views on TikTok, most of which are influencers using Thisworx’s vacuum.

This approach has been successful to the point that their vacuum cleaner currently ranks #1 on Amazon’s competitive “automotive products”category.

What’s next:
Thisworx is part of the TikTok-First Products meta trend.

TikTok has become a massive force in digital marketing—especially for DTC companies.

In fact, the #tiktokmademebuyit hashtag has over 7 billion views on TikTok.

And Amazon’s internet famous section is full of products that are trending or have gone viral on TikTok.

Examples of trending TikTok-first products include portable carpet cleaners, gua sha face rollers and curling headbands.

Terraswap (website, search trend)

Terraswap is a decentralized exchange using an automated market maker model.

The protocol is growing in popularity mainly because it is the first AMM DEX on the fast-growing Terra blockchain.

As the first AMM DEX on Terra, Terraswap allows users to trade their assets generated from other Terra protocols. For instance, a user that owns the Anchor Protocol token can exchange it for a Mirror Protocol token.

Unlike traditional AMM DEXes like Uniswap, Terraswap is not a permissionless AMM. This means that users cannot list tokens directly. In fact, for a protocol to be listed on Terraswap, the protocol needs to be approved by the Terra blockchain community. This lowers the risk of dangerous or scammy projects being listed on the DEX.

The total value locked in the Terraswap protocol is just over $1B.

What’s next:
Terraswap is part of the Terra Chain-based Protocols meta trend.

The Terra blockchain has seen explosive growth in 2021. The total value locked in this blockchain has increased 2500x since January 2021.

The current total value locked in Terra is approximately $12.88B—making Terra the third largest blockchain by TVL (behind Ethereum and BSC).

One reason behind this growth is that Terra has emerged as the best blockchain to develop stablecoin projects—especially algorithmic stablecoins.

South Korea has been the main driving region of this growth. South Koreans are increasingly using Chai—a payment app built on Terra—to purchase everyday items, such as coffee.

MyFO (website, search trend)

MyFO is an all-in-one SaaS tool for managing family offices.

The solution allows individuals to manage and safe-keep information regarding their family office (wealth information, transaction history, consolidated reporting, etc.).

The startup generated early attention when The 51 Ventures announced they had invested $500K into MyFO. MyFO has not launched publicly yet (they have a waitlist).

According to Pitchbook, MyFO is looking to close a $2M funding round, valuing the company at $12M.

What’s next:
MyFO is part of the Family Office FinTech meta trend.

A family office is a privately held entity created by wealthy families that manages the family’s wealth, information, privacy and assets.

The family office market is worth approximately $17.7B. However, until recently, only ultra-high-net-worth individuals have used these services.

But FinTech solutions are starting to disrupt this space by allowing individuals to implement family office management processes designed to manage wealth.

Canopylife and Malaa are examples of fintech solutions incorporating family office features.
Tomorrow’s Products Today
Interdental Brush (search trend)

Interdental brushes are designed to clean pieces of food and plaque between teeth.

The product is gaining steam because, according to the National Center for Biotechnology information, using an interdental brush is more effective than flossing.

An increasing variety of interdental brushes (eco-friendly, automatic, etc.) and the rising number of DTC dental care startups is also driving this product’s recent growth.

A popular pack of interdental brushes brings in approximately $50K/month onAmazon.

What’s next:
Interdental brushes are part of the DTC Oral Care meta trend.

61% of adults have “dental fear”, meaning that they try to avoid the dentist even when they need to see one.

And a growing number of these dentist-fearing consumers are turning to DTC oral care products.

While people still buy toothpaste (and other similar necessities) at brick and mortar stores, they’re increasingly shopping online for more advanced oral care products (teeth aligners, electrical brushes, teeth whitening solutions, etc.).

In fact, the DTC channel for advanced oral care products is gaining so much traction that established brands like Colgate are introducing DTC smart toothbrush lines.

Examples of trending DTC oral care startups include:

Toothsi is an at-home teeth alignment service. The company has served over 55,000 customers so far.

RiseWell DTC brand that sells all-natural oral care products containing Hydroxyapatite (the main component of tooth enamel).

AR NFT (search trend)

AR NFTs are non-fungible tokens that incorporate augmented reality components.

This means that users can use AR-supported applications and devices to view the NFT.

Think of it as Pokémon Go for NFTs. But instead of using AR to see Pokémon, users use AR to view specific NFTs.

AR NFTs represent a big revenue opportunity for artists, which is primarily why artists are jumping on this trend.

AR NFTs have also gained attention because of a wave of new AR NFT galleries.

For instance, NFT Stars is a virtual AR NFT gallery that can be accessed through a smartphone.

What’s next:
AR NFTs are part of the NFT Galleries meta trend.

Searches for “NFT gallery” are up by 9400% in the last 24 months.

Searches for this category have increased partly due to an increasing number of NFT exhibitions.

NFT exhibitions have become a popular way to launch NFT collections because they tend to generate more buzz vs. traditional NFT drops.

For instance, the price of the “Portrait of an Era” NFT exhibition increased 3x after the exhibition.

Even Zaha Hadid Architects has hopped on the NFT gallery trend with “NFTism,” a virtual art gallery displaying a variety of NFTs and virtual architecture pieces.

Smart Cutting Board (search trend)

A smart cutting board is an all-in-one chopping board with several smart features.

Many cutting boards are advertised as “smart”. However, this category is trending mainly due to the ChopBox—a smart cutting board made by The Yes Company.

The ChopBox is a 100% bamboo cutting board with several smart features (knife sharpener, digital timer, scale, etc.).

The product launched a Kickstarter campaign seeking $10K. And it met that goal within 25 minutes.

In total, the ChopBox raised approximately $2.26M by over 16,000 backers across Kickstarter and Indiegogo.

What’s next:
Smart cutting boards are part of the IoT Kitchenware meta trend.

Better nutrition, faster and safer cooking and reducing food waste are some of the reasons behind growing interest in IoT kitchenware.

For example, the automatic composter can break down food up to a tenth of its original volume. It also uses aeration, heat and pulverization to eliminate the bad odor that traditional composting generates.

Other appliances such as the 3-in-1 food processor help save time by allowing people to prep, blend, and juice their food with one gadget.

IoT is even impacting the traditional mug. The smart mug is a temperature-controlled mug that can keep drinks hot for longer.

SPC Flooring (search trend)

SPC flooring, an acronym for stand plastic composite flooring, is a vinyl flooring material.

The product is trending mainly because it’s 100% waterproof, quiet and durable.

A popular SPC flooring plank has a 4.5/5 average rating out of over 15,000 reviews on Home Depot.

The product is also gaining traction due to the fact that SPC flooring is straightforward to install, which makes it ideal for DIYers conducting home renovation projects.

What’s next:
SPC flooring is part of the DIY Home Improvement Makes a Comeback meta trend.

Searches for “DIY home renovation” have increased by 133% in the last 24 months.

The DIY home improvement market initially exploded during COVID-19 lockdowns (with around 80% of homeowners starting a DIY project).

And with an increasing number of people buying “fixer-uppers” due to the housing shortage, the DIY home improvement market is forecasted to continue its strong growth post-pandemic.

Libido Gummies (search trend)

Libido gummies help increase sexual desire (or sexual drive).

These gummies usually contain ashwagandha and vitamin E (often referred to as “the sex vitamin”).

Olly is a startup that sells a pack of very popular libido gummies.

Their libido supplements bring in an estimated $130K/month on Amazon.

What’s next:
Libido gummies are part of the Everything Gummies meta trend.

Gummies are becoming the de facto delivery method for many supplement categories.

In fact, certain gummy categories, such as magnesium gummies, are growing at around 130% YoY.

They are thought to be the “perfect DTC product” because they can be easily advertised and easily shipped.

This is illustrated by the fact that gummy sales across Amazon are increasing approximately 60% YoY.

This is why we are seeing an increase in trending gummy products such as sea moss gummies, hair gummies and melatonin gummies.
We hope you enjoyed this Exploding Topics Pro Investor report. If you have a minute, please respond and let us know what you think.
 
Thanks,
Brian and Josh
